Name: H.D.P.: Lo mejor del A.T.R.
Description: Micro expansion with 10 white cards, adapted from the lighter game of the same family, A.T.R.: Ahora Todos ReÃ­mos.

Name: Keine Panik!: Family Edition
Description:
This is the family edition from "Don't Panic".
There are category cards as in the base game, but each has 3 categories with one of the levels hard, medium and simple.
At the beginning of the game a level is set for each player, easy for children, hard for adults with many knowledge.
It's also a timed game, but each round the active player gets only 1 category and has to name 5 words, which match this category. The timer is stopped and the remaining number are the points he gets for this round.
3 times each player is allowed to ask for a new category (3 chips are available for each player to mark this)
After 5 rounds the player with the highest number of points wins.

—user summary

Name: Ratz Fatz Lieder-Spiel-Kiste
Description:
This children educational game is driven by the 29 children songs which are on the included CD.
The children may sing the songs while playing. There are multiple variants which can be played, e.g. grabbing the right wooden figure (30 included) or carton tile when it's named in the song.  
This game should help learning the German language, concentration and reaction.

—user summary

Name: Memo Match
Description:
In this game you have to collect 3 bird cards.
16 bird cards, 16 square memory cards (attributes)
Each bird has one of two possibilities of the 4 attributes: eyes, feathers on the head, beak, claws.
The activ player turns a bird card from the bird card deck.
Now he turns 1 memory card after each other, as long as he finds a matching attribute to the bird card.
If he finds all 4, he wins the bird card. If he turns a wrong attribute or a right the second time, his turn is over.
In bioth cases all memory cards are turned on the backside.
Who wins the third bird card wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Bingo Bongo
Description:
This is a combination of a traditional memory game and Tic Tac Toe.
Each player has his own Tic Tac Toe board with animals and fruits on the fields.
On players turd, he has to find pairs as in normal memory, but only the images on hios Tic Tac Toe board are relevant.
If he finds one of his, he covers this image.
Who first covers 3 in a row on his Tic Tac Toe board wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Fox Kids
Description:
In Fox Kids each player gets a board with 8 different cartoon character on them. You can also find these characters on a pile of circle shaped tiles that are in the middle of the table. Each player blindly chooses 5 tiles and try to see if they match any of the characters you have on your board. If so you can keep them, if not you return them face up, so everyone can see which characters is on that tile. Luckily there are a few wild cards among the pile which you can use to fill in a missing character on your board.

If you want to try to make it a bit harder, you can play level 2. You flip over your board and instead of the preprinted characters you get 8 empty circles on your board. On the added notepad every player picks for themselves 8 different characters they try to collect. In this way you can't really know what characters your opponents try to find. Whoever get's all of their characters first wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Geef oma een kus
Description:
Don't you just hate that grandma always wants to give you those big wet kisses. You are not the only one who doesn't like this.
 In this game everyone shares the same pawn that goes along a 12 step track. In order players play cards from their hands. On the cards are different types of actions that can either impress or disgust grandma. When you impress her the pawn moves up the track, when you disgust her the pawn goes down the track. And the end of your turn you take cards from the pile until you have 4 cards in hands again.

A player that plays a card which lands the pawn on step number 12 gets a big wet kiss from grandma. There is a lip shaped stamp and a lipstick you can use to create your own grandma's kiss on your cheeks.

The first player to get three kisses loses the game.

—user summary

Name: Les Simon
Description:
Each summer you spend your vacation with cousins in the mansion of grandpa, Hector Simon, the greatest adventurer in the world! This evening, he is absent and all his enemies will take the opportunity to take revenge. But they didn't count on you!
Search the mansion, create traps and save as many treasures as possible from the clutches of the Jealous!

Setup : choose a character and draw a random personality.
Phase 1 : the Jealous come inside, draw the first Clock card, it indicates the the number of Jealous to enter the mansion.
Phase 2 : Search the manor, every player draw Object cards.
Phase 3 : Assemble your objects to create traps.
Phase 4 : Reduce the resistance of the jealous by triggering your traps to save treasures.
				
				
					For each trap, you need to explain its operating mechanism out loud! Make way for the imagination and the pain!Phase 5 : All the Jealous still in the mansion will be able to steal Treasures cards.

The game ends when one full turn of the clock has been completed.

The game also ends immediately when 10 treasures have been stolen by the Jealous. You have all lost then and Grandpa will be very disappointed.

Name: Quickomino
Description:
Square tiles with each has 4 different images, one for each edge. There are 3 sets (different colors) used for the different player numbers.  
1 is placed in the middle. Each player gets the same amount of the remaining tiles (all tiles from 1 color are used).
All players play at the same time. They place their tiles 
 in the middle with matching (equal) images on all touching edges (domino rules).
The first player who places his last tile in the middle, wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Toggolino: Activity – Die Oktonauten: Erforschen, Retten, Beschützen
Description:
Childrens version of activity based on the "Die Oktonauten" TV series from Toggolino (SuperRTL, Toggo plus).
It's a under water submarine race. There are characters and things known from the series. These are described by one player with pantomime, drawing or description. Only the players who finds the right answer can move forward.
It can be played in 2 teams or cooperative.

—user summary

Name: Géants Stupides
Description:
In Géants Stupides ("Stupid Giants"), you land with your rivals on the mythical island of Night Mountain.

In this jubilant "stop or else", you land on the island of the mythical Night Mountain with only one obsession: get as many stars as possible! But your quest will be full of pitfalls!

So climb with your giant and pray to the ancestor to move rocks... Aim for the highest spot possible and jump to catch stars!

But the greedier you are, the more flying nonos and carcass hits will lead to nasty falls!

Borrow the superpower of the Ancestor's Head to transform the mountain by moving cubes... And unleash the Giant that growls inside you!

A colorful wooden game, with drawings by Marion Poinsot, the illustrator of Naheulbeuk comics.

With several levels: from the giant beginner to the stupid expert!

Name: Vs System 2PCG: The Marvel Battles – Into the Darkness
Description: This terrifying conclusion to the Darkness and Light story arc for Vs. System 2PCG provides an unnerving glimpse of the undead creatures that go bump in the night as well as the uniquely qualified heroes brave enough to shine a light on them. Journey into the shadows if you dare and challenge your opponents with the powers of darkness and light.

Name: The Office Trivia Game
Description: Are you a true Dunderhead?  Find out with 150 questions testing your Scranton smarts.

Name: WAU
Description:
Adopt puppies and be an ever-loving owner! - it is the slogan of the WAU which draws attention to the importance of adopting shelter animals and of being a responsible, loving owner.

In the game, players adopt puppies from the shelter and then trying to protect them from other players. Puppies need to be loved in their home as it is in real life, therefore, this way you can protect them from any upcoming danger. If you have 5 puppies in your little garden AND you prove that you are a responsible dog owner (aka you belove them with loving cards), you win the game. However, you should be careful and suspicious with the neighbours!

It is a fun, easy-to-learn, confrontative card game with the cutest dogs recommended for families and friends.

—description form the designer

Name: Tales from the Loop: The Board Game – Invasive Species
Description:
Expand your Tales from the Loop - The Boardgame experience with some invasive species from the late Cretaceous! The school is buzzing with wild Rumors about how the ice cream truck was attacked and the driver... eaten?!

The expansion contains a masterfully designed miniature of a Gorgosaurus Libratus as depicted in the art by Simon Stålenhag, as well as a completely new Scenario featuring it, and all the cards and sheets needed to bring it into your game.
Families: Game: Tales From the Loop – The Board Game

Name: Tales from the Loop: The Board Game – The Runaway
Description:
Expand your Tales from the Loop - The Boardgame experience with this runaway Machine! For the past week black vans and agents in suits have been seen in the area around the Loop. Rumors have it that they are searching for a spy...

This expansion contains a masterfully designed miniature of the Runaway Machine as depicted in the art of Simon Stålenhag, as well as  completely new Scenario featuring it, and all the cards an sheets needed to bring it into our game.
Families: Game: Tales From the Loop – The Board Game

Name: Do Not Wake Up Netiqrys!: An archeological adventure in the Ancient Egypt
Description:
An expedition, composed of subjects of various backgrounds (there are distinguished Egyptologists, valiant officers of Her Majesty, archaeologists in search of notoriety with their daughters, treasures hunters of every ream etc., and their respective carriers), runs through the corridors and rooms of an ancient Egyptian Temple miraculously remained intact in the sands of the desert,  in search of treasures and precious finds. But there are those who make good guard. And, above all, the Eternal Sleep of the Queen's Spirit is very heavy, but not entirely bombproof.

Do Not Wake Up Netiqrys! is a three-dimensional tabletop game, which is played with miniatures and on a map containing three-dimensional elements. It is a quite traditional dungeon crawler, so your characters (miniatures) move on rooms and corridors in order to reach the Hall of the Sarcophagus of the Mummy and to collect treasures. What makes the game a bit particular is the random generation of the path and of the enemies every time the characters turn a corner or open a door.

The rules are very simple but immersive, in order to satisfy both old friends of colonial or exotic miniature games and casual players or children. A game can involve a number of players ranging from one to six.

To play DNWN! it is necessary to have about twenty miniatures, normally in 28 or 20mm, including the Mummy, some of her Followers, some "Undead", as well as members of the archaeological expedition and their local carriers. You also need a 12-sided dice, a pair of 6-sided dice, some furniture to be disseminated on the path and a play area of about 90 cm - 36" per side, which will represent the perimeter of the Temple, within which the path will have to wind.

Everything else you will need is present in this issue that, in addition to the rules of the game and two sides of very complete “fast reference” tables (to play you will only need those), provides you with the "Character Cards", containing the characteristics of each of the protagonists, and also with the tiles for the construction of the path (including corridors, rooms, doors and so on) as you see it in the photos,  to print, paste and crop. In fact, DNWN! involves the random construction of the path during the game, an element that makes each match deeply different from any other and that allows the game to be particularly enjoyable even in “solo mode”.

Name: Dragonscales: Promo Pack
Description:
Limited edition promotional cards for Dragonscales. Includes powerful new items and artifacts for the Treasure deck!

Cards are:
Temporal Shifter - Once per round, you may pay 1 dragonscale to allow any player who is moving to move 1 additional space

Gem of Warding - Discard to cancel any attack against any player

Potion of Silence - Discard during the choose actions step when any player reveals their dice. That play may re-roll all of their rage outcomes

Counterspell - Discard at any time to cancel any villainy card as it is being played

Dragondmend Scroll - Discard the card to make all other players return one dragon wound of their choice back to the dragon’s head

Name: Quest: Volume I
Description: Quest: Volume I is a game with 2,520 general knowledge questions: World, Arts and Entertainment, Society, Science and Technology, Sport and Leisure and Variety. Before answering each question, the player must bet the amount of points he wants to walk on the board if he gets the answer right. Players can even choose the topics they know best to answer. But it's good to know all the subjects, as in the end you'll have to answer a question on the topic chosen by the other players. Are you up for this challenge?

Name: AGON: 24 táblajáték a nagyvilágból
Description:
AGON (Ancient Games Of Nations) 24 traditional board games in a playable book. The collection features 24 old abstract strategy games from all over the world, such as ancient Egypt and Mesopotamia, Africa, the Far East, North- and Central America, and Europe.

Pierrot, the author, wanted to make his book playable, therefore it was designed to provide large, hard cardboard surfaces, and the pawns and dice were supplied as punch board attachments. However, for an even better visual experience, players are encouraged to creatively collect or make more suitable pawns from various sources, such as glass pearls, pebbles, shells, buttons, pieces of wood, or pottery.

The 24 games included in this book are not exact replicas, as in many cases there are no original models considered authentic. Often, the circles and grids were just drawn on the sand, and then erased when the game was over. Nonetheless, enough information is available to create most of the prototypes.

The rules described in the book are based on the most widely accepted version for each game – and were thoroughly tested.
This Hungarian book includes the following titles, along with the author's own artwork:

The Royal Game of Ur, Bizingo, Fanorona, Puluc, Rimau-rimau, Yoté, Patolli, Jarmo, Mig mang, Ringo, Owari, Alquerque, Fox & Geese, Agon, Tablut, Tonkin, Siga, Pah tum, Senet, Sz’kwa, Surakarta, Hasami shogi, O-pat ko-no and Yut.


Pierrot táblajátékok iránti szenvedélyének és hosszú kutatómunkájának köszönhetÅ‘ ez a különleges album, amely huszonnégy tradicionális absztrakt stratégiai játékot tartalmaz. Valamennyi játék izgalmas idÅ‘utazás távoli korokba, távoli vidékekre, mint az Å‘si Egyiptom és Mezopotámia, Afrika, Távol-Kelet, Észak- és Közép-Amerika, valamint Európa.A könyv készítésekor fontos szempont volt, hogy az „játszható” legyen: nagyméretÅ± táblákat, merev felületeket biztosítson, és legyen mellékletként megfelelÅ‘ mennyiségÅ± játékfigura és dobóeszköz. Az utóbbiakhoz kartonkorongos megoldás szolgál, azonban a játékosok bátran lehetnek kreatívak, és maguk is gyÅ±jthetnek a témához, környezethez, korhoz illÅ‘  bábukat – fakorongokból, különleges gombokból, kerámia- és üveggyöngyökbÅ‘l, kavicsokból, kagylókból, és még ki tudja, hányféle forrásból.

A könyvben található 24 táblajáték nem szigorú értelemben vett rekonstrukció, mivel a legtöbbhöz nincs autentikusnak tekintett, eredeti modell. Ezeket a köröket és vonalakat sokszor csak a földbe karcolták, s a parti végén eltaposták a nyomokat. Csupán a kiváltságosok engedhették meg maguknak, hogy mesteremberekkel táblát készíttessenek. Ilyenek kerültek elÅ‘ egyiptomi és mezopotámiai királysírokból, vagy a gyarmatosítások kora utazóinak gyÅ±jtésébÅ‘l. Etnográfusok kutatásai nyomán viszont rengeteg apró részletet ismerünk, amelyek révén megalkotható a legtöbb táblajáték prototípusa.

Az egyes játékokhoz közölt szabályok a leginkább elfogadott változatot tartalmazzák – minden esetben  alapos tesztelést követÅ‘en.

Az AGON – 24 táblajáték a nagyvilágból címÅ± album a következÅ‘ játékokat tartalmazza – Pierrot saját illusztrációival:

Ur királyi játéka (The Royal Game of Ur), Bizingo, Fanorona, Puluc, Rimau-rimau, Yoté, Patolli, Jarmo, Mig mang, Ringo, Owari, Alquerque, Róka és libák (Fox and geese), Agon, Tablut, Tonkin, Siga, Pah tum, Senet, Sz’kwa, Surakarta, Hasami shogi, O-pat ko-no, Yut.

Name: Runes of Zun: Promo Card Set 2
Description:
A set of rare and powerful cards for Runes of Zun. Each card is designed to make gameplay a little crazy. Include one, two, or all three in your Runes of Zun deck to spice up your game. You can even add multiple copies of the three cards – play your way!

“Mimic” lets you copy a card

Use it to make a "copy" of any active card on the table and put it in your hand. Just pick a card that's in play (including ongoing effects), grab it, and put Mimic in its place. It's like Steal and Reserve combined – only better!

“Decoy” is a new reaction card

This reaction card prevents you from being affected. After resolving the action you're reacting to, you can't be touched until your next turn. Drop this decoy down and make your escape!

“Cheat” lets you take from the discards

Yes, any card. Just play Cheat, then start digging through the discard pile like a crazy person until you find that sweet card which your opponent foolishly threw away. It's yours now! Oh, and you can Boost it, letting you take more cards. This can be a big game-changer.

Note: The Kickstarter version has a star on the cards that identify them as from the Kickstarter. Second printing doesn’t.

Name: Runes of Zun: Promo Card Set 3
Description:
A set of rare and powerful cards for Runes of Zun. Each card is designed to make gameplay a little crazy. Include one, two, or all three in your Runes of Zun deck to spice up your game. You can even add multiple copies of the three cards – play your way!

“Surge” lets you power up

Use it to peek at the top 5 cards in the deck and put any modifiers you find right into your hand! After you put the rest of the cards you looked at back on top of the deck, you'll have advanced knowledge of those cards, which can be very useful.

“Divine” lets you get an extra card every turn

Take a card from the deck at the end of your turn. If you can also guess the card type before you take it, you can keep Divine in play for your next turn!

“Absorb” is a new reaction card

Play it as a reaction, then take that action and any modifiers played against you into your hand. Sweet, sweet revenge...

Note: The Kickstarter version has a star on the cards that identify them as from the Kickstarter. Second printing doesn’t.

Name: Borderlands: Mister Torgue's Arena of Badassery – Loot-Splosion Campaign Supplement
Description:
The Loot-Splosion Campaign Supplement will collect all digital scenarios and campaigns in physical printed format. It also includes an additional two complete campaigns.

Available scenarios and campaigns include:
- Ravenous Wattle Gobbler Scenarios
- Steve the Psycho Scenarios
- Crumpets and 'Zza Campaign
- 2x Loot-Splosion Campaigns
- All Bounty Scenarios (Bounty scenarios have their special rules printed on the bounty card and use an existing scenario map layout.)
- Core Game Campaign
- Skags at the Gates Campaign
- Robot Revolution Campaign

–description from the publisher

Name: Clash of Armies: Medieval – Climas
Description:
8-card Weather expansion for Clash of Armies: Medieval.


The second expansion of the game that adds a weather mechanic that will modify the conditions of how we play.

Name: My Bot Bytes
Description:
My Bot Bytes is a fun and fast-paced action programming game that will have the entire family coding without them realizing it! Teaches kids (and adults) some basics of coding!

You are interns trying to impress the Scientist to be the chosen one! Control two Bots to collect spare parts hidden around a Robotics lab. Bots can be coded to move using Navigation control cards but watch out! - the Scientist's Navigation System only gives limited navigation cards. Use logic loops to build logic into the Bots to move around obstacles (which include the Scientist's pets!). Be the first to navigate your Bot to collect all spare parts and complete your assembly board to win!

Game setup randomized so that no two games are alike!

Name: Adventure Builder
Description:
Adventure Builder is a perfect game for kids and families to get started with roleplaying games and shared story-telling.

Easy for parents and kids to quickly dive into fantasy roleplaying experiences.
Simple & exciting character progression. 
An entire city to explore between adventures, with dozens of encounters, games, and puzzles.

The Adventure Builder box contains everything you need to start the adventure without any delay. Explore the world of Florea using a large, full-color map, delve into the rules and the secrets hidden in the Guide's Handbook, pick your equipment and pets from the Equipment Shop, grab a character sheet, dice, and tokens - and you're ready to play!

A variety of Encounter, Creature, Coin, and Story cards will create the adventures for you without any need for lengthy preparations.

Name: Alexandros
Description:
Simple wargame following Alexander the Great's conquest of the Persian Empire and India.

Each player has two armies, led by Alexander and Antipater on one side, Darius and Memnon on the other side. Each army has a strenght track and is represented by a single counter on the map. Combat is resolved rolling a die per player, with various modifiers.

Alexander must conquer most of the Persian Empire and India before turn 14 to gain a decisive victory. A minor victory can be achieved by conquering Egypt instead.

--user summary

Published on "Guerre e Guerrieri" magazine, issue #37.
Families: History: Wars of Alexander the Great
Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: 5 Surprise Mini Brands!: Mini Market Dash! Game
Description:
Get ready to dash! Race around the market using one of the Mini Brands Collectable movers, gathering all the Mini Brands you can. Complete your cart to collect them all!

—description from the back of the box

The game is based on a series of collectible miniatures based on actual brand name items, four of which are included to use as pawns representing the players. Players also receive three cards representing a shopping list, with three food items on each. On your turn, you roll a single die (d6) and move that amount around the board. If a space has a face-down token it is revealed, and if it is an item you need you can pick it up and put it on your list (it stays on the space if not). There are also a few "wild" tokens that can used for any item. Other spaces let you draw from a deck of cards with a variety of actions, including stealing tokens from an opponent's list. Complete a list and you get another, and the first player to complete three lists wins. Any token from a completed list is put in the center and can be collected if a player lands on an empty space; as such, the game picks up pace as it goes on as more items are readily available.

Name: House of Cronies
Description:
To play House of Cronies, each player’s Cabinet consists of up to 6 cronies; each carrying a set number of votes, plus an optional foreign ally. All cronies, besides the foreign allies, can be elected as president or vice-president. Other positions such as Finance, Justice, Service Delivery and Communications, can only be filled by specialists.

Two decks of cards are placed on the table: the main deck and the tactics deck. The main deck consists of influence, corruption and crony cards and the tactics deck contains only tactics cards. Players start with seven cards from the main deck and two tactic cards each. Any cronies or foreign ally in the initial hand must be placed in the cabinet immediately (and any crony or ally that can not be placed is discarded).

In each round of House of Cronies, five cards are drawn from the main deck and placed face up in the middle of the table. In turn order, players can either pick up an influence / corruption card OR bid influence, corruption or a combination of both for a crony. Players can only gain one card per round, so any player who outbids another forfeits their turn. Players that are outbid, get their turn and their influence / corruption bid card back.

The end of the game occurs when there are no cards left in the deck or fewer cards than needed to draw for a new round. A final round is played for players to buy and used tactics before the election takes place and the player with the most votes wins!

Name: Das große "Oh wie schön ist Panama" Spiel
Description:
Each player is given a piece to roll to Panama and back as quickly as possible. On the way there are special fields on which you have to test your memory by revealing the matching tile to the field you have reached. If none of the 3 revealed tiles is correct, you have to travel back to the next special field. The first player to return home (after reaching Panama) wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Schermstrijd
Description:
Schermstrijd is a family game. Children battle against their parents to gain more screentime! It's a simple card game in which you try to duplicate the colored wifi-code laid out in the center of the table. Sabotage your opponents and be the first to complete your code to win the game!

The game is played in 3 to 5 rounds (you can choose). Set a starting time and roll the dice to see how much screentime can be added or extracted. 
4 colored wifi-card are layed out in the center in the beginning of the round. The first player to duplicate the code wins the round.

During a turn you roll a dice to see what actions you may perform. This can vary from stealing a card to changing the code in the center. You play cards to complete your code or to prevent your opponents to complete theirs.

Schermstrijd the battle is a fun and easy family game to end discussions about, well... screentime. In only 30 minutes of offline fun it is settled. Do you dare to battle?

—description from the publisher

Name: Galaktion: Messengers of the Void
Description:
Galaktion: Messengers of the Void is a tactical co-op sci-fi story-driven dungeon crawler game for 2-5 players, with an option for solo play.

The game will take you to the far future of the Milky way, where a team of renegades are hired by a shadowy corporation to fix a messy experiment with galactic proportions.

Unique setting, armed with tight game rules, allows you to “learn-as-you-crawl” through the dungeon maps and master your strategy against the game. Randomly spawned enemies and skill based characters will allow you to choose from variety of skills and abilities to find your best game style cooperating with your team mates. In Galaktion: Messengers of the Void, the team play means survival.

—description from the designer

Name: MAKALOT
Description:
"The Different Game"

The game is promoted as "fast moving, surprising - different". It is played by four players on a 13x13 multi-coloured checkered board. On each side of the board, there is a role (producer, doctor, politician, and opportunist). One of these roles is assumed by each of the four players. Playing time is presented as being one to two hours. The board also states that the game is "a game of skill", played with "no dice or cards".

MAKALOT was published by Modern Games Company in Oaktown, Indiana. The copyright date is 1937, held by Roy A. Beard. A "patent pending" notation is shown on the game board.

Name: Waste Knights: Second Edition – Beyond the Horizon
Description:
Beyond the Horizon is a massive expansion for Waste Knights: Second Edition, a postapocalyptic game of adventure and survival. Now is the time to leave the continent, embark upon a ship and sail to places you only know from legends and myths.

Explore a new map enabling you to visit Tasmania, Solomon Islands or New Zealand altered by the Apocalypse. Learn the truth behind the infamous Project X, while battling deadly sea monsters and experiencing strange weather phenomena.
Seek for fresh water – a new resource that will make the game even more realistic and challenging both for sea-farers and continent dwellers.

Play as one of new Knights armed with unique abilities and expand your base game using tens of new cards, tokens, and adventures to experience a setting of enormous proportions however you like – solo, cooperatively or competitively.

Choose your ship, set the course and see where the winds shall take you!

-description from publisher

Name: Caveosaurus Dinos
Description:
A rampaging herd of dinosaurs are circling a peaceful cave village. Located far out in the dusty desert plains, the village's only defence against the prehistoric invaders are their very own Clyde, Charlie, Chester & Chuck. Rallying together throughout the night, can the brave team chase off the Caveosaurus Dinos?

A fast paced co-operative card game for 1 to 4 players with a game length of 15 minutes. On a players turn they will draw two cards from the deck and will choose to play one and discard the other. Cards will allow a players caveman to move around the village circle of caves, send in an enemy dino, rotate the attack spear or hopefully chase off a dino.

Once a day and night has been played the team of cavemen can add up their total score for points awarded for chasing dinos, caves protected and if they returned to their home caves.

—description from the designer

Name: Sweets in Wonderland
Description:
Sweets in Wonderland is a trick-taking game where players draft the conditions of each trick, aiming to achieve the most points.

Specifically, players draft if the trick will be must-follow or can't-follow for a randomly revealed un-dealt card, and if high cards will win or low cards.  Players may also play 1 or 2 cards on their turn.

The winner of a trick wins the chips used for drafting the round conditions, and the start player for the draft rotates.

At the end of the game, the player with the most points, determined through a set collection mechanic with the drafting chips, wins.

Name: Golazo: Managers Expansion Pack
Description:
The Managers Expansion Pack comes with cards that add ten managers to the game.

Each of the Golazo Managers has 3 special abilities to give you an advantage over your opponent! Choose your manager at the start of the game.  You can only use each card once, so use them wisely!

Note: each of the 10 managers has their own special ability cards that are different from those of the other managers.

Name: Slash & Spells
Description:
How will you build your Victory?

Slash & Spells is a  Hero Building Battleground. Embody your Legendary Hero and unlock your unique ability tokens using magical Relics across the realm. Command clever card play and take ever-evolving heroic actions.

Slash & Spells is an epic duel using action selection, variable player powers, and hero tech trees tied into your relic choices. Players control unique Heroes drawn into an epic battle during your turn you take 6 basic actions to grow in power, attack, move, play cards from your unique hero deck, and ultimately knock down your enemies by reducing their health to zero.

The battle takes place via attack actions and playing cards from your hand. Each card that resolves deals their base Dmg and card effects to their target. Once a card has been played its card effect becomes an available action for your hero to take.

Victory is yours when you claim the most Knockdowns by the end of rounds and can claim your true destiny!

-description from designer

Name: Stampede
Description:
Stampede is a set-collection auction game themed around stamp collecting.

On a player's turn, they reveal 1 to 4 cards from a prepared deck to auction.  The players then choose how many dice to roll.  The player who rolls the highest amount is the winner, but will pay the value of the second highest amount rolled.  The players pay their bids in dice, with each 6 coins (pips) they need to pay consuming 1 of their dice.

The end of the game is triggered once a certain card is revealed near the bottom of the deck.  The player with the most points from the cards they've collected wins.

Name: Pierniczki
Description:
Master Caramel's pastry shop is famous for the most delicious gingerbread. It gets so many orders that the master is no longer able to fulfill them on his own, so he asked you for help, which is a very responsible task! Each gingerbread must have the right shape, plenty of icing and the right sprinkles. Those of you, who deal with your tasks as quickly as possible, will surely fall into the favors of Master Caramel... and get a pot of icing to lick off! So get to work!

Pierniczki (The Gingerbread) is a game that combines the element of memory with matching shapes and colors, which is why it is perfect for the youngest children.

—description from the publisher

Cukiernia mistrza Karmela sÅ‚ynie z najpyszniejszych pierniczków. SpÅ‚ywa do niej tyle zamówieÅ„, Å¼e mistrz nie jest juÅ¼ w stanie ich samodzielnie zrealizowaÄ‡, wiÄ™c poprosiÅ‚ Was o pomoc.To bardzo odpowiedzialne zadanie! KaÅ¼dy pierniczek musi mieÄ‡ odpowiedni ksztaÅ‚t, duÅ¼o lukru i odpowiedniÄ… posypkÄ™. To z Was, które najszybciej upora siÄ™ ze swoimi zadaniami na pewno wkradnie siÄ™ w Å‚aski mistrza Karmela... i dostanie garnek lukru do wylizania! Zatem do dzieÅ‚a!

Gra Pierniczki Å‚Ä…czy w sobie element zapamiÄ™tywania, dopasowywania ksztaÅ‚tów i kolorów dlatego idealnie sprawdzi siÄ™ wÅ›ród najmÅ‚odszych dzieci.

—description from the publisher (Polish)

Name: Mythika: The Olympians
Description:
The world is new, and fledgling civilizations beseech you for aid. In this 2-4 player game, you will assume the role of a Greek God vying for control of the world and the future of your civilization. Wield divine power using asymmetric abilities and your customizable action deck. There are 13 Gods to choose from, providing a different challenge and experience each time you play.

As a God you exercise your will, represented by various cards and abilities, to build the world as you play. On your turn you will play cards and pay for their scalable effects by exhausting your civilization’s cities and temples.  New cities and temples can be built when your population grows, making your action cards more powerful and your turns more efficient.  You’ll be able to shape the shared world map as players choose which unique hex-shaped land tiles to add, giving the mortals new areas to grow into.  Each land has its own mix of geographic type, attack and defense bonus, population growth rate, potential build sites, movement cost, and location abilities.  No two worlds will look the same.   You will also guide your Hero and High Priestess to go on quests, use location abilities on land tiles, lead your people to new areas, or convert the non-believers. There are also 12 powerful mythological creatures that can be summoned, each with their own abilities to enhance your strategy.

As powerful as you are, the mortals are not entirely within your control as they have their own free will.  They will pray for various signs, protections, or resources, and answering these prayers will grant you a range of benefits in return.  In addition, at the end of each player's turn the population will move and grow in response to the Mortal die's result.

The game ends after 3 Ages of raising mountains, answering prayers, causing catastrophes, unlocking technologies, warring, and building cities, temples, and monuments. Victory points are awarded for area control of the world, your completed quests and world-building secret objectives, technological discoveries, military victories, Follower's morale, and other achievements. Each God also has their own way to earn VP.  The god with the most VP takes their rightful seat on Mount Olympus.

—description from the publisher

Name: Kanzleramt
Description:
Nowhere are the opposites of good and evil more evident than in politics. And in this board game.

Honest, committed and capable rulers oppose lying, cheating and scheming fellow citizens. In the struggle for power in the role of Chancellor / Chancelloress, some people will use any means. 
As a member of politics, you must assert yourself in this - often unfriendly - environment and also be able to deal with unfair means of competition in order to decide the question of the next Chancellor for yourself.
 Based on real political events, you will experience this tension and all these contradictions in Kanzleramt.
Your path to the chancellor's office is long and rocky, and it always leads through the Bundestag. It is important that you get as many members of your own party as possible into the Bundestag. Because in this parlor game they elect the chancellor at the end.

As in real life, the path to this position is practically never straightforward and is marked by both positive surprises and setbacks. Luck, skill, fighting spirit and a wide variety of political events influence the path of your party's politicians to the Bundestag.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Name: Trains of Europe
Description:
On a map of Europe, you build track to fulfill your contracts.
On his turn, each of the players chooses one of 6 action phases and triggers it. All players act while the triggering player has an advantage (like in Puerto Rico). In the contract phase, you choose contracts that include a start city, a destination city and sometimes 1 or 2 in between. It says which type of locomotive you are allowed to use and which and how many wagons.

In the building phase, you connect any 2 cities by paying for the track you build. In the market phase you buy locomotives and wagons, in the auction phase you must offer at least one locomotive or wagon that is not yet part of a contract. In the reward phase, you get money for your connected cities and in the state subsidy phase you  receive a locomotive or wagon for free. At the end of a round all players receive income according to their partly or completely fulfilled contracts.

After a player has an agreed amount of fulfilled contracts, the game ends and you get points for fulfilled contracts, income and connected cities and minus points for contracts not at least partly fulfilled.

—user summary

Name: HackBots
Description:
HackBots is a strategic card game of sabotage for 2-5 players. The object of the game is to raise your opponents’ device risk and hack their devices before they hack you.

Each player lays out three Device Tokens in their playing area. Next, deal 4 cards face down to each player. Place the remaining deck face down to create the Draw Pile. Then, flip over the top card to start the Discard Pile.

On your turn, draw one card from the Draw Pile or Discard Pile. Play one card from your hand. You can ATTACK an opponent by raising the risk on one device, DEFEND one of your own devices by lowering or resetting the risk, or DISCARD one card if you cannot or do not want to play a card.

When a device’s risk reaches level 4, it may be hacked. Once a player has three hacked devices, that player cannot win the game. However, they remain in the game and continue to attack the remaining payers until there is a winner.

The last player remaining with at least one unhacked device wins the game!

Name: リカー・フォー・レディ (LIQUOR for LADY)
Description:
ãƒªã‚«ãƒ¼ãƒ»ãƒ•ã‚©ãƒ¼ãƒ»ãƒ¬ãƒ‡ã‚£ (LIQUOR for LADY) is a 2 player card game from Japan. The theme has the players trying to buy the right cocktail for woman at a nightclub. Each player chooses a card in secret and reveals it simultaneously. If the difference between the values on the cards is more than 3, then the lower card wins (the lady liked the drink offered).

The player that favours the most woman at the bar is the winner.
user summary

Name: 子リスのほっぺ (Korisu no Hoppe)
Description:
å­ãƒªã‚¹ã®ã»ã£ãº (Korisu no Hoppe) is a card game from Japan. Players are young squirrels, trying to collect acorns, but under the effect of action cards.
user summary

Name: Stalingrad '42: Little Saturn / Winter Storm Expansion
Description:
A small expansion for Mark Simonitch's Stalingrad '42 which adds an additional scenario covering the period from December 14th, 1942 through February 5th, 1943. 
The scenario portrays the Soviet Little Saturn offensive following up on Operation Uranus, against the German allies of Romania and Italy. The German forces attempt at the same time to break the Soviet encirclement of the 6th Army with Operation Winter Storm. Counters are provided for the Soviet Ostrogozhsk-Rossosh Operation against the Italians and Hungarians, the Voronezh-Kastornoe Operation against 2nd Army, and the final offensive against Stalingrad, Operation Ring.

Contents

    1 8-page Little Saturn/Winter Storm Booklet
    1 half-countersheet
    1 Axis Setup card
    1 Soviet Setup card
    1 Turn Record track with Reinforcements
    1 updated Stalingrad ‘42 Rules Booklet
    2 updated Stalingrad ‘42 Player Aid Cards

Name: Mal kurz die Welt ändern: Promokarten – Deutsche Geschichte
Description:
2 Karten:

Sophie Scholl - 3 - Bis zum Ende deines nächsten Zuges darf niemand Karten aus der Hand ausspielen.

Johannes Gutenberg - 1 - Diese Karte hat +5, falls genau 1 Karte in der Auslage liegt.

Name: Coralon
Description:
Coralon is the base trick-taking game for Crab Fragment Labs' Vines deck.  The Vines deck has eleven cards in five suits, including Ace (high) and four face cards: Knight, Bishop, Farmer, and Tar. Below these are the ranks 7 through 2. Games with the Vines deck include several trick-taking games for 3 to 6 players, including cutthroat and team games, based on familiar mechanics from games like Hearts, Pitch, and Euchre, with an abundant assortment of clever innovations.

Players bid on the number of tricks they will win, with the highest bidder leading and choosing trump.

If you make your bid, you score the number of tricks won and your opponents score nothing.

If you make over your bid you and your opponents all score the number of tricks won.

If you make under your bid you score nothing and your opponents score the number of tricks won.

Game ends when one player reaches a winning score (dependent on number of players).

Name: Five-Star Review Game
Description:
Everyone on the internet has an opinion. Some more outlandish than others. In this family friendly trivia game there are 5 categories related to reviews left by people on the internet:

One Star Wonders - There are always winners and losers - these are the losers.

Mystery Basket - What's being described here?

Facts & Stats - Sort out the truth from the fake news.

Historical Howlers - Wild reviews from the days before the internet.

Fill in the Blanks - Identify the missing words to complete these reviews.

A sixth category "?" provides a little chaos and randomness with unique challenges provided on each card.

Players move around the board to each of the different category zones trying to collect a star card from each one by correctly answering a question.

First one to collect a star card from each category and make it back to the center of the board wins.

Name: Age of Journey
Description:
Age of Journey is a "slightly" different kind of worker-playing game in which you develop a forgotten village in the mountains. The game is based on the idea that workers (warriors) and resources (livestock) are two sides of the same coin. If you send a large number of people to raid an area, you will earn more money, but you will have fewer actions to perform. In addition, the dominance of the colours over the area makes the management of your warband very difficult. Use the sale market to sell your livestock at a high price and invest in various cards to get rich!

Worker pieces are double sided. On your turn, you choose a number of workers to send to a given space. One worker occupies the space, triggering it's  while the remaining workers flip over to become the depicted resources. These resources can then be sold on a variable market, allowing you to buy skills, more workers, and Estates, which are the main source of victory points.

The player with the most victory points after 3 rounds (short & solo games) or 4 rounds (long game) is the winner.

—user summary

Name: Cafe Chaos: Animator Pack
Description: This pack include 34 cards all based around characters from the YouTube series. It has 9 characters with their own actions, plus 8 foods, 2 toppings, 2 conditions, 2 bonus actions and 2 events.

Name: The Legend of Zelda Game Comic Part 1
Description:
A very rare, limited release board game bundled and sold with candy by Bandai.

The players spin the wheel to figure out how much to move (1-3 spaces). Then, they move their token and defeat monsters (also by spinning the wheel) to collect weapon tokens.

Once someone has four weapon tokens, the game turns into the dungeon phase, wherein players race to get to the boss and defeat it, acquiring a triforce fragment. Then the game goes back to the overworld and the process is repeated.

Whoever has the most triforce pieces by the end of the fourth dungeon wins.

Name: Cafe Chaos: Junk Food Pack
Description: This pack has 28 new cards focused on expanding your food cards. It includes 2 new character and their actions, 12 foods, 3 toppings, 3 conditions, 3 bonus actions and 3 events.

Name: Office Survival
Description:
A card management game with 3-5 players. Players change their positions in each turn so everyone will have a chance to be the boss, or the lowest-level employee. Players have to finish their task with their ability cards and get the merit. According to different position, players can change the situation by using their special ability card. For example, a lower level clerk may shift his job burden to his /her supervisor by using a Sick Leave card.

There are Ability card and Task card. Players pick and collect ability cards first in order to fulfill the condition of getting a task card.

After finishing a task card, player can get coins as reward. Player who first collects 3 black coin wins.

Name: Cafe Chaos: Sooubway Pack
Description: This pack has 28 new cards adding food to your game based on that famous footlong place. It has 2 characters and their actions, 12 foods, 3 toppings, 3 conditions, 3 bonus actions and 3 events

Name: Cafe Chaos: Royal Pack
Description:
Introducing the King’s court! The characters in Cafe Chaos are in for a royally good time. These 8 new characters now feature a RANK (shield with number). This ranking is in addition to the character power, and ranked characters can be played mixed in with non-ranked characters.

Also included in the 34 new cards are 8 foods, 2 toppings, 2 conditions, 2 bonus actions and 4 events

Name: Mont-à-Mots Mini
Description:
Help climber Sam reach the yeti at the top of the mountain in this cooperative vocabulary game.

Sam needs your speed and your vocabulary to overcome obstacles and reach the top of the mountain. Roll the dice, find out on a map the challenge you will have to meet and each time you succeed, Sam can move a little further towards his goal.

Players pick a challenge card off the draw stack and roll a die to see how many words they must recite to meet the challenge.  If no one can pick a correct word, they must roll the die and move back that many spaces.

Who wins? Whichever team or player first gets Sam to the top of the mountain.


Un jeu de vocabulaire coopératif
Aidez l’alpiniste Sam à rejoindre le yéti au sommet de la montagne!Amateurs de jeu de mots, voilà votre chance de briller aussi en alpinisme avec Sam, qui a besoin de votre rapidité et de votre vocabulaire pour franchir les obstacles et atteindre le sommet de la montagne. Lancez le dé, découvrez sur une carte le défi que vous aurez à relever et chaque fois que vous réussissez, Sam peut avancer un peu plus vers son but.

Qui l’emporte? L’équipe ou le joueur qui, le premier, permettra à Sam d’atteindre le sommet de la montagne.

Name: Magic: The Gathering – Chronicles
Description:
An extension of Magic: the Gathering 4th edition. Drawn from the first four Magic: the Gathering expansions. All cards in the set were from the Arabian Nights, Antiquities, Legends, and The Dark expansions (14 from Arabian Nights, 21 from Antiquities, 71 from Legends, and 19 from The Dark). Each card was white-bordered, while the cards in their original sets were black-bordered. Also, each card carried the expansion symbol from the set it was originally printed in.

The set was printed in English and Japanese only. The Japanese version was black-bordered, because as it was the first time those cards were printed in the language. A similar black-bordered set called Renaissance was released into German, French, and Italian markets. These contained a different array of cards.

Name: Shadows of Brimstone: The Hellmouth
Description:
A famous writer has gone missing, last seen heading into the hills in search of the fabled Hell Mouth rumored to reside in the dark depths of the local mines. Now the Heroes have been hired to find him and bring him back alive. But the dark tidings foretold in his recent stories have begun to bear an eerie resemblance to reality, building toward something sinister.

This limited edition, deluxe resin terrain piece depicts a massive eruption of stone and a swirling portal of darkness – the Hell Mouth, an all-new piece for Shadows of Brimstone, plus a new mission - Through the Mouth of Madness - themed for the new piece!

The Hellmouth acts as a gate for enemies or the void by doubling the number of encounters, attacks or growing dead on the exploration token and adding enemies to fight.

Name: Shadows of Brimstone: Challenge Pack #2 – Beast Unleashed
Description:
Legend tells of a sinister beast that stalks the caves and canyons of Black Rock, a thriving mining town north from the ruins of Brimstone. Known as The Devil of Black Rock, they say it towers over normal Slashers and has grown mutated beyond recognition. With four razor-sharp scything arms, it eviscerates its prey, feeding on their souls as it shreds their flesh. Layered in a thick shell of light-refracting Void Chiton, The Devil of Black Rock phases through time and space with shimmering speed, warping in and out of reality as it strikes!

Challenge Pack #2 – Beast Unleashed is themed for facing off against the infamous Devil of Black Rock and his hordes of beastly minions that all use cards from the new Beast Unleashed Enemy Trait cards set. A Legendary foe, hunting the Devil of Black Rock is not for the faint of heart. It shrugs off attacks with its thick shell while phasing through the Void to activate multiple times per turn, shredding the Heroes with each slash!

A Challenge Pack is a new themed set of cards with a terrifying new Enemy and a nightmarish new Mission designed to give the Heroes an extra challenge. These cards are all used together for the included Mission; but can also be added to your card decks to increase the challenge across your normal games of Shadows of Brimstone as well. Many of these new cards are marked with a Challenge Icon, to be easily identified as extra dangerous.

Challenge Packs reward players for having a robust collection of Enemies and Expansions; and contain several Threat cards that include a mix of various Enemies from across the game. Some of these Threat cards even add new bonus ability to the Enemies on the card for thematic ways that they can work together to crush the Heroes.

The following Expansions are highly recommended to get the most out of this Challenge Pack (though these sets are not required to use this Supplement, most of the Threat cards included in this Challenge Pack do use various Enemies from these other Expansions):


     Swamps of Death core set
     City of the Ancients core set
     Blasted Wastes OtherWorld deluxe expansion
     Flesh Mites enemy pack
     Void Swarms and Void Hive enemy pack
     Dark Stone Scorpions XL enemy pack


—description from the publisher

Name: Shadows of Brimstone: Forbidden Fortress – XL Living Statue Miniature + Exclusive EPIC Threat
Description:
These can be used for the different types of Living Statue (Stone, Wood, and Metal) and can allow you to fight Epic battles against multiple Living Statues.

This expansion contains:
- 1 XL Living Statue Miniature
- 1 Epic Threat Card - Temple Guardians (2 Living Statues) - Promo 409

Card Text: 
Draw an Enemy Trait card for both Living Statues
Fighting Pair: While either of these Statues has less than 10 wounds on it, both Statues are +1 combat

Name: The Red Dragon Inn: Bitecoin Promo Card
Description:
SlugFest Games promo prize card for donation to Extra Life 2021!

Text on the card:

Bitecoin
Prize
Bitecoin counts as a Gold Piece. Whenever a player gains Bitecoin in any way other that winning it in a Round of Gambling, that player loses 1 Fortitude. If Bitecoin would be paid to the Inn, it goes to the Prize Bin instead. If you pass out while you have Bitecoin, it goes to the Prize Bin before you split the rest of your Gold.

Name: Nightfighter Command
Description:
This is a free print and play WW2 solo narrative game where you defend Southern England against the Nazi bombers. Based at Middle Wallop or West Malling RAF base you will be directed to fly against German bombing raids to protect various Naval bases, towns and cities.

At first you may struggle with unreliable equipment and inexperienced ground controllers but as you gain experience your skills and eventually the equipment at your disposal will also improve - if you live that long!

—description from the publisher

Name: 4.20 Game
Description:
In this cannabis-themed party game for adults, each player has to take a card and pass the indicated test. A test is like a challenge, for example, "guess a movie by doing mimic". If you pass the challenge correctly, you earn victory points.

Game ends when there are no more cards. The player with most victory points wins.

Think green and play responsibly. No plants have been harmed during the creation of this game.

ESTE JUEGO DE MESA  NO PRETENDE FOMENTAR EL CONSUMO DE SUSTANCIAS NOCIVAS PARA LA SALUD, SIMPLEMENTE OFRECE UNA ALTERNATIVA DE OCIO CREATIVO PARA CONSUMIDORES HABITUALES.

4.20 Game está pensado para amparar la igualdad entre hombres y mujeres, utilizando un lenguaje inclusivo y visibilizando de manera igualitaria la figura del hombre y de la mujer. Para ello las dos mascotas del juego son: “CLARITA LA SEMILLITA Y ANTOÑÍN EL COGOLLÍN”.

Por otra parte en las pruebas que hay que superar se ha considerado la posible diversidad física que pueda presentar cualquier participante. Se trata de un juego inclusivo en el que cualquier persona con movilidad reducida puede participar.

Para finalizar esta presentación es necesario mencionar que durante la creación de este juego no ha sufrido daño alguno ningún vegetal.

Name: ¡Yo No Tomo!
Description:
¡Yo No Tomo! (I do not drink!) is a hilarious card game that appeals to competitiveness and is designed for meetings with friends where drinks and the desire to have a good time are present.

The game challenges each team to get all the cards in their BAR before another does or before they have had enough to give up. In the attempt, each team must defend themselves with the cards they have in their possession to avoid getting drunk, while at the same time they can attack their opponents with cards that make them drink. This game is designed and optimized to be played in teams, but its optional individual version also works very well and is just as fun.

¡Yo No Tomo! is just as fun and competitive without alcohol, and for this it is recommended to draw the TRAGO cards.

Name: Iwapelé
Description:
Iwapelé is a set collection and pattern recognition game of African masks.

In their turn, players pick and discard a card, and make sets of 3, 4 or 5 cards, of the same community membership and geometric pattern, receiving points for each set.

The game ends at the fifth round or when a player reaches 500 points.

Name: Elefant, Tiger & Co. Das Zoo-Spiel zur Serie
Description: The 5 zoo area cards are laid out, the animal cards are added, all other cards are stacked face down, each player has 7 cards. Whoever's turn it is rolls the dice and moves the game piece, then he can lay or discard cards and draw new ones. Whoever completes a row with food, baby animals, scales with the animal keeper or regardless of cards laid with the veterinarian takes the row for victory points. When all the animals in an area are cleared, the player who has collected the most cards wins.

Name: Oltréé: Undead & Alive
Description:
OltrÃ©Ã© is a cooperative and narrative game where each scenario, called Chronicle, offers a rich and unique setting, with its atmosphere, unique plot, challenges, friends and foes! Each turn will confront you with hard choices, forcing you to manage your actions carefully to fulfill your quest!

In the satrapy, death has never been as final as one would like… Walking corpses, ravenous scavengers, minions of small dark gods, get ready for chilling encounters!
In their frightening adventures, the Rangers fight against the Languor, a morbid melancholy that seizes hearts and souls!

This first expansion contains:

    3 new Chronicles (1 short, 2 long, 36 cards total) confronting you with the shadow forces of the undead.
    6 new Mission Assignments, with a terrifying new Incident pack called "Death Abounds" (20 cards)
    The new Languor mechanic offering a thematic challenge (15 Languor cards)
    14 miscellaneous tokens


— description from the publisher

Name: Regenerate!
Description:
Regenerate! is a collaborative resource management game that teaches players about regenerative land management, sustainable development, and systems thinking.

The game is played over 20 Rounds during which teams design and deploy Projects that allow them to gain resources (Water, Energy, Food, and Capital) and score points with the Community. All resources must be managed efficiently and Community Score is used to assess the team’s performance at the end of the game.

Maintain regenerative conditions at Fly Ranch as you strategically develop the land, engage with the community, and manage natural and anthropogenic disturbances.

—description from the publisher

Name: Terror en la Noche
Description: An old suspense and horror game for kids and adults.

Name: J'y Crois Pas: Supplément Salades
Description:
In each round of Fake That! , the player in the role of "Gullible" will ask a wacky question. Each of the other players must answer either the crazy truth or...a big fat lie! Will the liars prove convincing enough? Will Gullible succeed in uncovering all of them without pointing out the right answer?

J'y Crois Pas: Supplément Salade is an expansion containing hundred new questions to renew and extend the discoveries.
It requires the base game.

Name: El Juego de la Riqueza
Description: International financial and commercial strategy.

Name: Doblejuego: Grand Pursang & Zodíaco
Description:
A collection of 2 family games:

Grand Pursang

Spectacular horse race with a minimum of 3 players and a maximum of 6. Before starting, the participants will decide how many races they will run per game. Each one receives an initial sum of money, with their objective being to obtain the highest capital at the end of the game. Each player, once received and studied his cards, bets on the horse that he considers can win, this choice is secret and is kept in reserve until the end of the race. Then, according to his card playing skills, his audacity and his luck with the dice, he will try to get his favorite horse to cross the finish line in 1st or 2nd place.

Zodíaco

Original, easy and exciting betting game where, starting from an initial sum that each player receives at the beginning of the game, the objective of each one is to conquer the greatest fortune. From 2 to 6 players participate and it is played without a time limit since only the luck of each one will determine the permanence of it. Let's try Zodiac and good luck!

Name: Krev a Písek
Description:
In Krev a Písek (Blood and Sand), players are gladiators who are trying to come out on top in the arena.

Each player starts the round with a hand of cards, and everyone secretly chooses and reveals a single card to serve as their starting attack value. In turn, each player plays a card to add to their attack, repel an opponent's attack with a defense card, or modify an attack or prevent a defense; alternatively, a player can pass to skip one turn. If all players are out of cards or pass in turn, the round ends, and whoever has the highest attack value wins. If, however, a player would increase their attack value to 5, they win the round immediately.

The round's winner receives Roman denarii, and whoever first collects 5 Roman denarii wins.

Name: Florist
Description:
Your goal in Florist is to create bouquets of three flowers as whoever first creates five bouquets wins.

To set up, shuffle the twenty flower cards, deal four to each player, then lay out the remaining twelve cards in a row. Each player places their florist card next to one of the six cards in the middle of the row, then the game begins.

On a turn, play a card from your hand to move your florist in the market, then pick up the card adjacent to where you moved and leave the played card in its place. If you now have a bouquet in hand — three cards of the same value or type or three cards in a straight — score a bouquet by revealing one flower on your scoring card, then replace the three cards in the bouquet with the three cards at one end of the flower market.

If your florist lands on the same space as the opponent in the market, reveal all cards in your hand to see who has the higher value and wins a point — except that you don't count cards that match the revealed symbols on your opponent's scoring card.

Name: Wild Assent: Lavon Rising
Description:
Wild Assent is a 1-4 player miniatures board game with solo, player-versus-player and cooperative modes. Battle your opponents in the gladiatorial arenas of the Silvestrem in Wild Assent’s skirmish mode. Hunt the dangerous creatures of the Wilds, by yourself or with friends, fighting not just for survival, but to keep your expedition running. Regardless of the mode you choose, Wild Assent offers strategic and varied combat, ensuring no two battles are the same.

Wild Assent: Lavon Rising is a reprint campaign for Wild Assent, the questionably named and overly- ambitious board game from Lazy Squire Games. We’ve learned a lot since we first started making the game, in terms of design as well as manufacturing and fulfillment. We’re taking that hard-earned knowledge and putting it back into Wild Assent, to make a great game even better.

Name: Wild Assent: Daughters of Draketh
Description: The Daughters of Draketh adds a new narrative-based campaign to Wild Assent. War is brewing in the Wilds and the key to peace rests in the hands of the Daughters of Draketh, a secluded tribe of ashcarii dragon riders. Choose a side and adventure deeper into the Wilds than ever before, battling (or fighting alongside) new creatures and mercenaries. This product will ship with Wave 2. Requires the Wild Assent Core Game only.

Name: Wild Assent: Waterways of the Wilds
Description: Waterways of the Wilds adds 28 new miniatures, including the massive XL Slithering Devourer and two new Assents/Seekers. It also adds a new double-sided gameboard with two different maps, each with their own terrain with unique effects. As per usual, there will be new scout cards, creature and wild creature cards, etc so the miniatures can be used in both the Hunt and Arena modes as well as new equipment pulled from the depths below. Wild Assent core game required.

Name: Guerra de Tronos
Description:
Guerra de Tronos is a war and strategic board game set in the Game of Thrones universe.

The game develops a war conflict that takes place on the continents of Westeros and Essos, divided into 54 territories. Each faction has a goal to meet, and to do so, they must expand domains, attack and defend against adversaries, mobilize armies and establish alliances.

In Westeros, the death of King Robert has created a power vacuum, and the Lannisters, Baratheon and Stark compete for the Iron Throne.

Meanwhile, in Essos, Daenerys Targaryen attempts to dominate Slave Bay and cross the Narrow Sea. The Free Cities seek to consolidate their independence, and the Wildlings cross to the south of the Wall fleeing death ...
Families: Books: A Song of Ice and Fire

Name: Borderlands: Mister Torgue's Arena of Badassery – Best Minion Ever
Description:
Defeat Captain Flynt and expand your collection of bandits with the Best Minion Ever bounty pack

Contains: 

     Captain Flynt miniature
     4 Nomad miniatures
     4 Bruiser miniatures
     all game cards needed to play


—description from the publisher

Name: Borderlands: Mister Torgue's Arena of Badassery – Badassasaurus Rex
Description:
BADASSASAURUS! This model is so big we have to include its own massive unique hex arena for it. This enemy that is the pinnacle of badassery it fills four hexes and is almost 6" tall when fully opened! In addition to the Badassasaurus model it includes Piston, a unique hex arena, printed scenarios and game cards.

—description from the publisher

Name: Elephant in the Room
Description:
Elephant in the Room  is a fast paced party game for 4 to 8 players.

Each round two players take on the role of speakers and draw a card from the deck. They must have have a conversation about the secret topic on the card while the other players listen in and attempt to guess the key words!

The other players try to guess the topic and if they get it right and they score the card and are the speaker next round! Guess wrong and they have to wait for another player to make a guess before they can try again!

Score enough elephants on your cards to win the game!

—description from the designer

Name: PizzaPorazzi!
Description:
The New Card Game to Create, Pizzas, Together.

Place 4 Pizza Cards on the Table.
Deal 5 Ingredients Cards to each Player.
Starting from the youngest player,
proceed clockwise.

On your turn, you must place at least one Ingredient close to a Pizza Card which contains it.
When you complete one or more Pizza Cards, just take them.

At the end of your turn, replace a total of 4 Pizza Cards on the Table and 5 Ingredients in your hand.

When all the PizzaCards are completed, who scored the highest number of Points...
Is the Winner!

—description from the publisher

Official PizzaPorazzi! Page with Pics and more descriptions:
http://www.warangel.it/PizzaEng.htm

Name: Dome
Description:
A cataclysm wiped out part of the global population and compelled all survivors to live hidden due to the harsh weather.

You are one of them and you heard some rumors about a dome build somewhere in the East. A place where you'll be able to start all over again and try to plant the seed for a new society.

Dome is a surviving deckbuilding game for 1 to 4 players in which every action you'll take will be critical. Your journey to Dome will be tough, whereas you'll try to find food, parrain new members for your crew or barter items for your survival.

Each player starts with the same deck. At your turn, you will play ALL your hand : 

     "Exploration" to reach Dome or send explorer to quest,
     "Food" to cook skewered frogs, 
     "People" to use their special skill if you feed them, otherwise they will starve to death...
     "Hope" to convince people to join your team or barter items.


When a player reach Dome or when three piles of cards are empty, the last turn occurs. The player with the most Influence Points on all the cards they acquired during the game wins.

—description from the designer

Name: Balaclava: Breaking the Siege 25 October 1854
Description: Balaclava: Breaking the Siege 25 October 1854 is a hex and counter mini-wargame from Decision Games. Uses the "Musket and Saber" Quickplay wargame system to portray the major battle of the Crimean War. Combat is based on unit quality rather than numbers. Special rules cover the Allied redoubts.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players
Series: Musket & Saber Combat System (Decision Games)

Name: Hougoumont: Key to Waterloo 18 June 1815
Description: Hex and counter wargame covering the battle for a single farmstead on the field of Waterloo.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players
Series: Musket & Saber Combat System (Decision Games)

Name: Hornet's Nest: Buying Time at Shiloh 6 April 1862
Description: Hex and counter wargame using the Musket & Saber Quickplay system, to portray the battle of Shiloh in the American Civil War.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players
Series: Musket & Saber Combat System (Decision Games)

Name: Little Round Top: Flank Attack at Gettysburg 2 July 1863
Description: Hex and counter wargame covering part of the action on the second day of the Battle of Gettysburg.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players
Series: Musket & Saber Combat System (Decision Games)

Name: Unsere Nationale Volksarmee im Manöver
Description:
Each player has 9 infantry units (Gruppe), 3 tanks (Panzer), 3 Anti-tank guns (PAK) and 3 grenade launchers (Werfer), wich are set up on opposite sides of the game board on the corresponding spaces. Movement is figure per turn. The pieces have different movement capabilities and shooting ranges. Some spaces cause terrain modifications.

A piece eliminates an enemy piece if it gets near enough to place the enemy piece inside its shooting range. Exception: a grenade launcher can't hurt a tank.

The goal of the game is to eliminate al enemy pieces to win the game.

—user summary
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: The Red Dragon Inn: One Thousand Cranes Promo Card
Description:
SlugFest Games promo prize card for donation to Extra Life 2020!

Text on the card:

One Thousand Cranes
Prize
The next time you ante, add this card to the Prize Bin. You may reveal any number of Gambling and/or Cheating Cards from your hand. For each card you reveal in this way, gain 1 Fortitude.

Name: The Red Dragon Inn: Water of Life Promo Card
Description:
SlugFest Games promo card for donatin to Extra Life 2019

Text on the card:

Water of Life
Drink Event
You may pay 2 Gold to the Inn. If you do, gain 2 Fortitude, then each other player pays 1 Gold to the Inn, then each other player gains 1 Fortitude.
A bit of Extra Life for everyone!

Name: Name The Thing
Description:
Have you ever said...

...that would be a GREAT name for a band?  Have you ever put two words together from two shops next to each other to make a hilarious name or phrase?  Well, Name The Thing might be the next party game for you to try!

Take turns reading prompts, judging names, and thinking up names to vie for the best names for things!  Can you be the wittiest of your friends and name all the things?

—description from the publisher
Families: Organizations: Game Designers of North Carolina

Name: Conquest: The Last Argument of Kings – The Spires Abomination Expansion
Description:
Abominations loom several man heights over the head of even the tallest mortal. Their gore slicked limbs spider out from its bulbous, distended abdomen and thorax. They are instruments of pure mayhem on the battlefield, scuttling forwards and reaping a bloody toll with their scythe like appendages, leaving only bloody ruin behind them. Survivors speak of a keening whine, just on the verge of hearing that pervades their memories, a sound that registers deeper than the cries of their fallen comrades. This is the only sound an Abomination can make, the only sound it is allowed to make: a keening howl to convey the depth of their misery and torment.

Abominations were not originally intended to serve as organic war engines. They were an advanced and cruel form of punishment, devised on a whim by the Sovereign. Ensconced deep within an Abomination lies the body of an Exile who has betrayed his trust or breached the most sacrosanct of Spire laws. Despite significant effort, even the Sovereign's most ardent opponents have not been able to come up with a more cruel punishment and have adopted this cruel torture for their worst enemies.

Invasive cerebral procedures impairs the cognitive function of the condemned, as chemical and hormonal treatments are applied to make them lose control of their Life-Binding gifts and forcibly bond them to a lower organism. Multiple organisms were proposed and tried but the humble ant was ultimately preferred. While more gruesome examples could be made, it was found that those Abominations bonded to other species were too intractable or self-destructive. The ant's instinctive hierarchical physiology somehow makes it more susceptible to Pheromonic command, forcing the body to respond to orders while allowing compromised psyche trapped within the hellish amalgam only enough control to wail its anguish even while enacting the will of its tormentors.

Name: Gladiators
Description:
Now's your chance to compete against your favourite Gladiator, with this exciting new three dimensional, action-packed board game.  This game enables you to recreate the Gladiators Arena in your very own home.  With easy assembly instructions, each of the 7 events have been minituarised to recapture the spectacle, and of course glamour, that is The Gladiators!

—description from the publisher

Name: Barbershop
Description:
Barbershop (or Strohmann Jass) is a two player game based on the traditional game Coiffeur Jass.

From the rules:

Introduction
This is the third game in an ongoing exploration of Strawman Variations--developing two player versions of trick-taking games by adding strawmen (one or more piles of cards, usually with the top card exposed, that form part of a player’s hand).

Object
Seventeen tricks are played each hand; certain cards are worth certain points; the object is to capture the most points. There is a small bonus for winning the last trick.

The Cards
A pack of 36 Swiss-suited cards is used consisting of A K O U B 9 8 7 6 in four suits (acorns, bells, flowers, and shields). If you only have a pack with French suits, you can use A K Q J 10 9 8 7 6 in clubs, diamonds, hearts, and spades.

The rank of the cards (and their point value) within each suit is, from highest to lowest:
Ace(11), King(4), Ober(3), Under(2), Banner(10), 9(0), 8(0), 7(0), 6(0).

However, when there is a trump suit, the rank (and point value) in that suit becomes: 
Under(20), 9(14), Ace(11), King(4), Ober(3), Banner(10), 8(0), 7(0), 6(0).

With a bonus of 5 points for winning the last trick, there is a total of 157 points to capture each round.
Families: Organizations: The Game Artisans of Canada

Name: Monopoly: Scott The Woz
Description:
Hey all, Scott here! Evade taxes like never before with the Scott The Woz edition of the classic board game MONOPOLY! Buy, sell and trade iconic locations from the series such as The Shaft Family Estate, The Litigation Station, and Stale Pretzels while using custom tokens of items on Scott’s desk! “Liquidate the company” and go for broke in MONOPOLY: Scott The Woz Edition!

The player pieces are a "The Internet and You" Tape, '08 Stack, Old Phone, Nostalgia Goggles, Party Hat, and a Tambourine.

Limited to 5000 units.

Name: Tuque
Description:
From the rules:
Introduction
This is a reworking of a two-player Euchre variant that I was taught about 35 years ago in Arnprior, Ontario (a small town near Ottawa). It appears to have been a local variation on Six Hand Almonte Euchre (which seems a reasonable conclusion considering Almonte and Arnprior are roughly 30km apart).

Object
Seventeen tricks are played each hand; the object is to win at least nine of them.
The Cards
A pack of 39 cards is used consisting of A K Q J 10 9 8 7 6 in four suits (hearts, diamonds, clubs and spades) plus three distinct jokers (called Bennies).
Families: Organizations: The Game Artisans of Canada

Name: Moosehead
Description:
Doppelkopf for Two

From the rules:

Object
Twenty-three tricks are played each hand; certain cards are worth certain points; the object is to capture the most points. There are bonuses for catching your opponent’s Ace of trump and for winning the last trick with the Jack of Clubs.
The Cards
The 48 card deck is made from a double pack that has been shortened by removing cards below 9: so each of the four suits contain two each of A K Q J 10 9.

In most contracts, the cards rank, from high to low:

Trumps: ♥10, ♣Q, ♠Q, ♥Q, ♦Q, ♣J, ♠J, ♥J, ♦J, ♦A, ♦10, ♦K, ♦9 (26 cards)
Clubs:  ♣A, ♣10, ♣K, ♣9
Spades:  ♠A, ♠10, ♠K, ♠9
Hearts:  ♥A, ♥K, ♥9

The cards have values:

A = 11    10 = 10    K = 4    Q = 3     J = 2

making a total of 240 card points. The basic object of the game is to take more than half of these card points in tricks. The card points are used to determine which team has won the round - they are not the same as game points which are written on the score-sheet as a result of winning or losing.
Families: Organizations: The Game Artisans of Canada
